sentences.en: Chandler's weasel face screwed into an obsequious smile.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒黄鼠狼似的脸上现出了谄媚的笑容.

sentences.en: Don't toady to or be obsequious to rich or powerful people.
sentences.cn: 不谄媚奉承有钱或权势的人.

sentences.en: Eldest son one's life life is to listen, obsequious, but finally however risk danger in desperation.
sentences.cn: 大儿子一辈子唯命是听 、 唯唯诺诺, 但最后却铤而走险.

sentences.en: He is a worker who is obsequious to the boss.
sentences.cn: 他是个对老板卑躬屈膝的人.

sentences.en: He is obsequious to men in power.
He was obsequious to his superiors, but he didn't get any favor.
sentences.cn: 他巴结上司, 但没得到任何好处.

sentences.en: No, let me be obsequious in thy heart.
sentences.cn: 不, 请让我在你心里长保忠贞.

sentences.en: She is an obsequious shop owner.
sentences.cn: 她是个善于谄媚的店主.

sentences.en: The landladies paid court to her, in the obsequious way landladies have.
sentences.cn: 女店主们以她们特有的谄媚方式向她献殷勤.

sentences.en: The manager's obsequious assistant annoyed the other employees in the department.
sentences.cn: 谄媚的经理助手惹恼了部门内的其他职员.

sentences.en: The obsequious brush curtails truth deference to the canvas which is narrow.
sentences.cn: 谄媚的画笔依从狭窄的画布把真理打了折扣.

sentences.en: The obsequious brush curtails truth in deference to the canvas which is narrow.
sentences.cn: 阿谀的画笔顺从目光短浅的画布,真理因而被削弱.

sentences.en: The secretary is exceedingly obsequious to the manager.
sentences.cn: 这个秘书对经理极尽阿谀奉承之能事.

trans.tran_cn: 奉承拍马的，卑躬屈膝的，谄媚的
trans.tran_en: very eager to please or agree with people who are powerful – used in order to show disapproval
